Articles.Content:
2 hours ago, SiCaRiO31 said:

When I try to move the KER windows while on top of the right-click menu of a command pod, it moves both, not the one on top. Am I missunderstanding the pruporse of this mod? Because I trought it was supose to prevent clicking what was underneat the windows you tried to use. 

This mod only works with mods that use it.  Kerbal Engineer doesn't use this, so there's nothing I can to to block it.  Best to move KER windows first

2 hours ago, SiCaRiO31 said:

Also, sometimes I cant create a maneuver node (nor warp)  and I have to go back to the KSC and then back again to the vessel for it to be fixed. Anyone else having that issue?

Not sure how that is anything to do with this

16 hours ago, linuxgurugamer said:

This mod only works with mods that use it.  Kerbal Engineer doesn't use this, so there's nothing I can to to block it.  Best to move KER windows first

Ah! thanks, thats what I wanted to know.

 

16 hours ago, linuxgurugamer said:

Not sure how that is anything to do with this

Im not sure either, its a separated problem, I just said that in case anyone experienced something similar, since I started to notice that issue after installing a few of your adopted mods, but Im not sure its specifically a problem with toolbar controller or something different.

I've been experiencing a bug where probes are controllable without a signal even with require signal for control on, the only mods I have installed are Toolbar Controller, ClickThrough Blocker, and Zero MiniAVC. On the latest version of KSP but experienced this bug even after reverting to 1.11.1.

heres my ksp.log https://mega.nz/file/6CxgzaaA#BbnSS5-Wy1iatUYdt1j9S-YWvmMG0M7ah9mjB0UAG_E

heres a video of the bug https://mega.nz/file/SHQ0xJyZ#4l4wKdJy2OnpEqhLUc4fyf-Awo8UuM7zaxtMFuT6Orc

11 hours ago, Connor Gorski said:

I've been experiencing a bug where probes are controllable without a signal even with require signal for control on, the only mods I have installed are Toolbar Controller, ClickThrough Blocker, and Zero MiniAVC. On the latest version of KSP but experienced this bug even after reverting to 1.11.1.

heres my ksp.log https://mega.nz/file/6CxgzaaA#BbnSS5-Wy1iatUYdt1j9S-YWvmMG0M7ah9mjB0UAG_E

heres a video of the bug https://mega.nz/file/SHQ0xJyZ#4l4wKdJy2OnpEqhLUc4fyf-Awo8UuM7zaxtMFuT6Orc

These mods have absolutely nothing to do with that.  They don't even do anything if no other mods are referencing them.

Remove those mods and try again, and post in a general thread.

Just an FYI, you also have at least one mod from Sigma installed, as well as the expansions

New release, 0.1.9.5

  • Renamed DLL for CKAN compatibility
  • Added AssemblyFileVersion
  • Updated version file for 1.12
just reporting that installing the update with CKAN broke  some of the buttons

3 hours ago, Johan Seutens said:

just reporting that installing the update with CKAN broke  some of the buttons

Log file, pics are needed

And a description of what actually broke

25 minutes ago, Xt007 said:

Possibly these lines from the log can help?

How many times do I need to say that I need THE COMPLETE LOG FILE?

New release, 0.1.9.6

  • Reverted DLL name change, too many mods were using the original name
     

To those who posted about the problems:

Please don't assume I can read your mind.  Log snippets are fine, IF you include the full log.

I had to make an install to test this out, a fix would have been faster if you all had provided the FULL LOG FILE which I always end up asking for anyway.  

Lucky this time I was able to quickly find the problem, you might not be so lucky in the future

Log file after new release, main menu is unresponsive

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1EFdgdaaVixgLP6jbMV8VQeBlVafwQlqU/view?usp=sharing

27 minutes ago, Xt007 said:

Log file after new release, main menu is unresponsive

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1EFdgdaaVixgLP6jbMV8VQeBlVafwQlqU/view?usp=sharing

Did you possibly install it by hand?  I installed a few of those mods in my test, reinstalled toolbarcontroller using CKAN to get the latest, and it loads fine

I don't see the following lines in your log file, it's absence indicates it's not loaded: 

  100 AssemblyLoader: Loading assembly at R:\KSP_1.12.0_dev\GameData\000_Toolbar\Plugins\Toolbar.dll 
  103 Load(Assembly): 001_ToolbarControl/Plugins/ToolbarControl 
  106 AssemblyLoader: Loading assembly at R:\KSP_1.12.0_dev\GameData\001_ToolbarControl\Plugins\ToolbarControl.dll
Thank you, that did the trick.  Trying to avoid ckan since putting together a modbashed ksp right now is challenging with mods targeting three different version.

1 hour ago, Xt007 said:

Thank you, that did the trick.  Trying to avoid ckan since putting together a modbashed ksp right now is challenging with mods targeting three different version.

Well, installing via CKAN will usually avoid most problems.

I'm having the same issue that Xt007 was (I think) where the main menu is completely unresponsive. I also don't have the huge popup anymore that shows how all my mods aren't designed to work with 1.12.2  But the game was working fine as of a few days back (not sure, maybe 5-7 days since I played last? Can't remember), but fired it up tonight and the main menu buttons just don't do anything. Tried clearing input locks via alt+f12 and no dice.

All mods installed via CKAN with maaaaybe one or two exceptions. (and I forced a reinstall of toolbar controller via ckan as well). And all mods are fully updated

Thanks in advance for any and all help and wisdom!

By hand, delete the complete directory for the toolbarcontrol and then force a reinstall.  If it still doesn’t work, send me the log files, will look at them in the morning

7 hours ago, Krydax said:

I'm having the same issue that Xt007 was (I think) where the main menu is completely unresponsive. I also don't have the huge popup anymore that shows how all my mods aren't designed to work with 1.12.2  But the game was working fine as of a few days back (not sure, maybe 5-7 days since I played last? Can't remember), but fired it up tonight and the main menu buttons just don't do anything. Tried clearing input locks via alt+f12 and no dice.

I was having a similar problem. A clean install solved it. I am even using the same save.

Just so you know, the problem is an extra DLL file, caused by the previous update.  It's still there in the directory.  When you do a reinstall without manually deleting the directory, it's left behind.  By deleting the directory and  then doing the reinstall, only the correct one will be there

5 hours ago, linuxgurugamer said:

Just so you know, the problem is an extra DLL file, caused by the previous update.  It's still there in the directory.  When you do a reinstall without manually deleting the directory, it's left behind.  By deleting the directory and  then doing the reinstall, only the correct one will be there

Ohhh okay. Thanks for that clarification. There is a reinstall button in CKAN which I assumed is what you were getting at. I'll try that out later when I'm at my computer and report back

2 hours ago, Krydax said:

Ohhh okay. Thanks for that clarification. There is a reinstall button in CKAN which I assumed is what you were getting at. I'll try that out later when I'm at my computer and report back

I did, but when I saw the log file, I realized the problem.

On 8/11/2021 at 2:59 PM, linuxgurugamer said:

I did, but when I saw the log file, I realized the problem.  

Unfortunately... It didn't work. I manually deleted toolbar controller folder from gamedata, along with deleting all the toolbarcontroller downloads in the CKAN cache (in user/appdata/local), and used the reinstall button on toolbar controller in ckan (since it still thought it was installed), it went and downloaded the newest version and installed it. And I'm still getting unresponsive main menu buttons.

Your problem is JNSQ.  Delete the Kronometer from JNSQ, it's broken in 1.12

See this post for a patch:

5 hours ago, linuxgurugamer said:

Your problem is JNSQ.  Delete the Kronometer from JNSQ, it's broken in 1.12

Holy cow you are a saint among men!

Not only did that work, but now I also have the added benefit of station keeping, precise manuever, and docking port alignment indicator now all working (they weren't before)!!!!! Thank you thank you!
